item.title: Caution: Normal Apgar Scores and Prompt Legal Action for Birth Injuries
item.description: The birth of a baby boy or girl is a milestone event of life that every parent remembers. In the hustle and bustle of labor and delivery, a lot of things happen. One of the first assessments performed on a newborn is the Apgar score, a quick evaluation that’s been around since the 1950s to look at the baby’s overall health. However, it’s crucial to understand that a normal Apgar score doesn’t necessarily mean that the baby has not suffered a brain injury during labor and delivery.
